content:
I do not have access to the most up-to-date information or opinions about the dallas cowboys, but i can describe the changes in the management structure of the dallas cowboys over the past decade based on my database:

1. in 2010, jerry jones was the principal owner, general manager, and president of the team. he remains the principal owner, but has made significant changes to the management structure since then.

2. in 2013, jones hired former green bay packers executive, tom ciskowski, as assistant director of player personnel.

3. in 2014, jones promoted stephen jones, his son, to chief operating officer and executive vice president. stephen jones has been involved in the team's operational decisions and salary cap management.

4. in 2015, the team hired will mcclay as the assistant director of player personnel. mcclay has played a significant role in the team's scouting and drafting process.

5. in 2018, the team hired kris richard as the defensive passing game coordinator and the secondary coach. this was part of a broader restructuring of the coaching staff.

6. in 2019, the team hired jon kitna as the quarterbacks coach and kellen moore as the offensive coordinator. this was part of an effort to improve the offense.

overall, jerry jones has remained the principal owner of the team, but has made changes to the management structure to help the team succeed.
